channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Motorcycle joyriding late at night, 16th February
item.description:
There are frequent motorcyclists joyriding up and down the Thames footpath in front of the golf driving range. You can see the skid marks on the ground that show this late night activity (9 pm - 2am, sometimes later) The noise from that activity can be heard from the residents living across the river on the Isle of Dogs. It is meant to be a footpath for pedestrians and cyclists and not for motorcyclists. It is not safe for pedestrian and it is noise pollution.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge needs collecting, 16th February
item.description:
It’s been dumped here since last week from the people who live there. Please remove this asap it’s blocking the pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westcombe Hill, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground needs repairing, 16th February
item.description:
This playground is in need of repairs. When it rains it gets very muddy and it takes days before it is usable again. Seating stools for parent are full of water, and the area where kids actually play are muddy. See pictures attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Entrance 30 on Grafton Way., 16th February
item.description:
This has bewn a problem for a very long time. The concrete around the manhole was broken and sunken,then a couole of weeks ago worknwn turned up. They dug it up,replaced the concrete wuth tarmac and put cover back. They put barriers at each side,but in less than a hour,a Tesco driver got out and moved them and drove through,and so does everyone else. The noise has gotren far worse than before,it bangs even louder whenever something drives over it. I feel sorry too for the 2 hoapitals either side,and the nuses in this block on nightshift.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Personal E-bike being locked in communal area, 16th February
item.description:

This street light is out as are all the light that have EV charging points fitted in BIRKBECK ROAD, CLARENCE CRESCENT, CLARENCE ROAD AND GRANVILLE ROAD. THIS IS NOT THE FIRST TIME OBVIOUSLY A PROBLEM.

item.title: Wobbly tiles, 16th February
item.description:
These tiles are extremely loose around the manhole cover at the end of my path, won’t be long till the public trips over and twists ankle or worse. 10 dukes orchard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dukes Orchard, Coldblow, Greater London

item.title: Large deep pot hole, 16th February

item.title: Multiple Deep, Long Pothold in Junction of Ilderton Road and Surrey Canal Road, 16th February
item.description:
There are multiple potholes in the junction between Ilderton Road and Surrey Canal Road this poses a hazard for both drivers and cyclists. This is because when trying to go straight across the junction many vehicles make slight swerves to avoid the potholes. I am also worried because when cycling across the junction, it can already be very stressful due to the high traffic. Adding both the potholes and high traffic and I am worried an accident may happen the road surface is very uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Canal Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt out car, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coleridge Walk, Temple Fortune, Greater London

item.title: Multiple holes in road, 16th February
item.description:
Multiple pot holes in road on Leesons way and on petersham Drive. These are getting bigger. They need filling asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countless large, severe, sharp-edged, dangerous potholes, 16th February
item.description:
This whole stretch of road needs to be completely resurfaced. There are countless potholes, the majority of which are unavoidable and very sharp-edged, which are highly likely to cause severe damage to vehicles. I’m tired of reporting road defects in this area one-by-one as there are too many to count, let alone report individually. All repairs carried out in recent months have already failed, and the surface is either sinking again or new pot holes have already formed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole has developed next to the cycle lane, outside 228 Lower Road, 16th February
item.description:
This pothole is getting larger and the road surface around it is crumbling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
